_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accident Release Prevention Program and Emergency Response Policy:



It is the policy of the Ajinomoto Foods Carthage Missouri facility management to implement the requirements of this Risk Management program (RMP) in accordance with the USEPA regulations under 40 CFR Part 68 and with the corresponding regulations under OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) program. The objective is to minimize the risk of a release of a hazardous material and if a release occurs, to minimize the potential impact to Ajinomoto Foods employees, the public and the environment.This objective will be accomplished by utilizing general good operating procedures, providing appropriate training to all employees, and coordinating response activities, as necessary, with the local response providers. This plan covers all Ajinomoto Foods owned activities at this facility.

Ajinomoto Foods management is committed to providing the resources necessary to implement this policy



Facility Description: Ajinomoto Foods operates a food processing facility at this location. Ajinomoto Foods is a producer of Asian potstickers, batter fried and batter breaded  vegetable  & cheese appetizer  products. Support operations include cold storage, an analytical laboratory, and administrative offices.



1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

Ajinomoto Foods takes many precautions to prevent or minimize accidental releases of ammonia from the refrigeration system.  These precautions include safety controls (detection systems, alarms and automatic shutdown devices) which are designed to identify and prevent potentially unsafe conditions like pressure increases that could cause a system failure.  We also have a preventive maintenance program designed to maintain the on-going integrity of the systems and a training program designed to ensure that the systems are operated by qualified personnel.  All employees are informed of hazards in the workplace.  Employees who work with potentially h

azardous substances receive proper training in the handling of those substances.  This facility has procedures in place to safely remove employees from areas in the unlikely event that a hazardous substance release were to occur, and to put in place emergency notification and response procedures.

2. Facility and Regulated Substances

Ajinomoto Foods located in Carthage, MO processes and stores various food products. The regulated substance at this facility, anhydrous ammonia, is used in a closed-loop refrigeration system for product cooling and preservation. In order to protect its employees, the public and the environment, an integrated safety management program has been established to prevent ammonia releases and mitigate the consequences of a release, should one occur.

3. Worst Case and Alternative Case Release Scenarios

Off Site Consequence (OCA) data is available for review onsite at the Ajinomoto Foods facility.

4. General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Ammonia Specific Prevention

The Ajinomoto Foods facility has an accidental release prevention program that complies with OSHA's Process Safety Management Standard and EPA's Risk Management Program Rule. The prevention program consists of the following elements:

- Employee Participation Program

- Process Safety Information

- Process Hazard Analysis

- Operating Procedures

- Training Program

- Contractor Safety Program

- Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures

- Mechanical Integrity Program

- Hot Work Permit Procedures

- Management of Change Procedures

- Incident Investigation Procedures

- Emergency Planning and Response

- Compliance Audit Procedures

The Carthage, MO facility has an emergency action plan that addresses the response necessary for a release of ammonia from the refrigeration system. Because of the pungent odor of ammonia, any leak is easily detected.  The compressor rooms are provided with ammonia detectors that activate if ammonia is detected.  The refrigeration system is

designed so that major components can be isolated by closing selected valves.  Further, refrigeration system operators have been trained and are knowledgeable in the safe operation of the refrigeration system.  In case of a release that could travel off the plant property, calls would be made to the Carthage Fire Department and the Local Emergency Planning Committee to assist in the response.  Other state and federal notifications would be made as required.

5. Five Year Accident History

There have been no reportable releases of ammonia in the last five years.

6. Emergency Response Program

This food processing facility has procedures in place to respond to the release of a hazardous substance.  Employees are trained to evacuate their respective areas in accordance with OSHA 1910.38(a).  Coordination with the local fire department is initiated during an emergency situation.

7. Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Ajinomoto Foods expects to improve safety performance by emphasizing all elements of its PSM/RMP program.  All recommendations during the Process Hazard Analysis were designed to improve the safety performance of the ammonia refrigeration process.  Ajinomoto Foods expects to evaluate each recommendation in a timely manner and implement, as soon as possible, those recommendations that will reduce the possibility of a release and/or mitigate the consequences of an unintentional release.
